qas.question: When were the earliest Upanishads composed?
Of what philosophical system do the Upanishads form the basis?
What are the Upanishads called in Hinduism?
What part of the Hinduism belief system did the Upanishads attack?
What worship system is central to Hinduism?

context: The <a0_0>7th and 6th centuries BC<a0_0/> witnessed the composition of the earliest Upanishads. Upanishads form the theoretical basis of classical <a1_0>Hinduism<a1_0/> and are known as <a2_0>Vedanta<a2_0/> (conclusion of the Vedas). The older Upanishads launched attacks of increasing intensity on the <a3_0>ritual<a3_0/>. Anyone who worships a divinity other than the <a4_0>Self<a4_0/> is called a domestic animal of the gods in the Brihadaranyaka Upanishad. The Mundaka launches the most scathing attack on the ritual by comparing those who value sacrifice with an unsafe boat that is endlessly overtaken by old age and death.
